title: Particle motion from velocity graph part - b

content.description: A car is traveling on a straight road. For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>24</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CAB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds, the car's velocity v(t), in meters per second, is modeled by the piecewise-linear function defined by the graph above.
content.question: For each of v'(4) and v'(20), find the value or explain why it does not exist. Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: For each of v'(4) and v'(20), find the value or explain why it does not exist. Indicate units of measure.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
